title: "I'd rather have a toxic teammate than a bad one"
body:
Alright guys, here is a really good topic (not created by me) that's been widely discussed in some of the other regions, and seeing how it's not in OCE yet I would like to share it here and see what our region's stands are on this.

Do you guys agree that having a toxic person playing neutral/well (maybe even carrying the game) but flaming and cursing all game is better than having a friendly person who is doing badly (and maybe feeding) but constantly apologizing and encouraging the team?

replies.body:
Depends,
In ranked for me, either is fine, but if you're toxic and feeding/trolling, or if you blatantly tell us you're going to ragequit, well report button will be pressed. You can be toxic and still try to win. You can be apologetic and feeding but still trying to win. I'll put up with alot so long as the team is still at least playing together and trying to win.

In normals, however, since there isn't the pressure of ranked, you don't really have an excuse for being toxic outside of being a bad person.

I agree with HeartVine. One person who's doing bad but is positive, you can drag them and the game back. One person who is doing ok/good but is toxic is dragging down the whole rest of the team, even if you yourself mute them. Toxicity snowballs into bad playing and more time spent typing than playing the game. One person not doing so hot just has to play safe and be carried.

This is good IN THEORY, but realistically, if you're team mates doing bad (and lets face it, they aint gonna be positive. its just not how it works here) you're not gonna really make a comeback and win. They'll at most score a kill or 2, but its not going to save you when the enemy team is fed af from him playing like absolute trash. Because theyll all get fed off him, then the rest of the team, then you. 
Not sorry to disappoint you.

Seras Dragon is right, _(i don't know why they get down voted so much? they are one of the people who do more for this community than anyone, show a little bit of respect please guys.)_

one toxic player can drag down the whole team, but worse than that, toxicity stunts the growth of players. So bad players stay bad when they're abused all the time for being bad.

If you help them, encourage them, be nice to them, give them ganks, keep them alive to get some assists, they learn and improve, and maybe you won't win this current game, but next time you play a game with that player, they'll be a little bit better. Maybe you still won't win, but if you keep aiding them, maybe the next game you play with them, you will win. They'll know how to play into a losing game better and turn it around for you, rather than getting all depressed because the team is on their back about everything and then popping up that 15 min surrender vote.

For me, the worst thing is to be the best player on the team.
**1.** It means your team is shit and you're probably not going to win anyway.
**2.** it means you won't learn a damn thing, and won't improve much at all.
**3.** You spend too much time judging other people's actions, not your own, and again, won't improve.

So if you help the people who are worse than you, and learn from the people who are better than you, not only do you have a much more enjoyable game, but it means that future games will also be more enjoyable, because which each new game, the skill gap will close, making games closer and more interesting to play.

>(i don't know why they get down voted so much? they are one of the people who do more for this community than anyone, show a little bit of respect please guys.)

I've seen the same argument used on youtube, and i'll give the same counter argument here.

It's a way someone can show that they don't believe in the opinion presented, sure it's not always the most helpful, but asking people not to dislike things because of them doing more for the community is flawed, and shows that your less wanting other people's opinions and more just want to look good.

Not to mention, using the same argument, Riot would never be down voted even when they are doing something the community doesn't like.

> shows that your less wanting other people's opinions and more just want to look good.

While I more or less agree with the point you're attempting to make, I'd say that's somewhat of a flawed statement. Up/down votes give very little, if anything, in the way of opinion, rather they're used as a measure of agreement. The only real way to give an opinion in this kind of environment, especially one people will consider, is to actually *say/type* something. That, at least, will give people an indication of the specifics of how you view the situation, and they can agree, or disagree, with you wholly, or partially, whereas up/down votes indicate more of a definite view one way or the other (and are typically anonymous).

Off the top of my head, I'd say the word "agreement" is more fitting the the context.

Maybe it's different in your games, but often I'll be on a team with someone not doing so hot, and one of a few things happens. 

Maybe you end up not being able to carry them and you lose, but you've had a positive (or neutral) game and you leave knowing you lost just because the enemy team was better, you can't win every game. 

Maybe you support that player with ganks or roams or maybe you can't but you can keep them alive in teamfights at least. They pick up some assists and come back at least a little. They probably won't be winning any 1v1s but they can contribute at least. You end up winning, great job.

Or maybe your jungler messes up a gank top, and the top laner starts abusing them. They're spam pinging, talking shit. At best, the top laner is wasting their time typing, and their lead to tilt. At worst, they drag the jungler into it. Maybe someone else makes a mistake, or tries to defend the jungler, and then they're dragged into it to. Suddenly more than half your team is bogged down in this shitfest of a chat (which you are completely uninvolved in). You lose that game because noone is playing anymore. You'll always lose that game because everyone has given up.

So yes, I'll take a bad player over a toxic one any day.

hahahaha you think so? that is the ideal scenario. 

Let me tell you how reality is; The feeder gonna farm side lane for the rest of the game, while you keep losing tower to team fights; Eventually baron and the game.  

You can be nice and hold his hand during the laning phase but once you leave he gonna feed. Or cant even cs because he is as the title suggest "BAD"! Then build the most bronze build and contribute almost nothing.

There are a BIG DIFFERENT BETWEEN Doing bad, and being a bad player.
Some games you can't win, there's no surprise there. But I disagree with you.

You can mute the toxic guy. The nub players, forget it. He is just a feeder for the rest of the game. Have you actually played with a boosted player in rank before? I rather take the toxic player over a boosted player that after he feed a plenty; Say it ok guys, we can still win.

A boosted player wasn't in the original scenario, the OP only said someone who was doing badly. I'd still take a friendly boostee over a toxic player anyway. A team can carry one person, but if they get tilted and can't even carry themselves it's game over.

that what bad player are in rank. You have the average player that belong at that elo. Which it is entirely up to you to carry and step up. And bad player, the boosted nub that just get outmatch and feed.

Which prove he is playing in an elo he dont belong in.

For me it depends on wether it is ranked or not.

I _**hate**_ ranked, but when I play it, I just want to win, screw mastery scores, screw having fun, screw picking champs I want to play, I want that LP, so id rather win and be carried by toxic people, than lose with friendly folk and be the best player on the team. I hate the ranked environment, so having toxicity as well doesn't make it any less enjoyable for me, I already hate it, so I might as well just pick the option most likely to win.

_(Im quite a thick skinned person though, to me toxicity is just hollow words, it's some adolescent trying and succeeding to prove how much of an idiot they are, hardly worth getting offended over it.)_

However in normals, I would rather have nice friendly people any day, in normals for me its all about having fun and pushing my personal best, often I don't give a fuck if we win or lose as long as I know that I personally played well, or we had a bucket of fun. and the best environment to do that, is a friendly happy one.

As for which do I prefer overall, toxic and good or friendly and bad.
Ill just say that I have 4000+ normal games under my belt, and at max probably around 300 ranked games total since i started at the end of season 2. So I'm sure that you can make your own assumptions from that.
Personally in ranked where I to play win, yes. In normal where I play to practice/ for fun, I couldn't care less if all my teammates went 0/100.
I'd take the toxic one every time, cause i really couldn't care less what they say.
Obviously the toxic one because you can just mute them to solve the problem, you can't do anything about someone being bad at the game.

when the aim is to win as many games as possible then yes. You can mute toxicity but as long as they are playing the game properly then I really DGAF. Norms is different - that is an environment to try new champs or builds without too much pressure and you cant expect to go into every norm and win and if you do then you're going to have a bad time. But you can reasonably expect to go into a ranked game and have everyone try hard to win.

What bothers me most is people who are nice in chat but who make toxic plays. This could be not listening to team, doing stupid things and then flaming team (without key words that get you insta'd), legit looking but troll builds / lane picks, or they could be flat out trolling.

You can win a game with a person who takes the game seriously but flames and there is a mechanism to mute their toxicity. You cant win with someone who stays silent in chat buy buys 6 pairs of boots.

I'd rather have a friendly player that is also good.
Why is this not an option?

Personally, I will always prefer an "unskilled" player over a toxic player. In my experience, people always tend to do better when there's a positive environment, and always tend to do worse when there's a negative environment. I'd much rather "suffer" an "unskilled" player at their best, than a toxic player who is, more than likely, tilting the majority of the team. I'd much rather a player who is always acknowledging their mistakes and looking for ways to win than a player who is always hounding and abusing their allies.

That's just me, though.
